metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3069 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mercurial before 3.7.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary codevia a crafted name when converting a Git repository.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3069` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mercurial - 2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4
mercurial-common - 2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mercurial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4').
